intro: Connarus revolutus, commonly known as the curled connarus, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often curled or rolled at the edges. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
